SEA WAVES CUP RULEBOOK

  • All the players and teams entering the tournament are required to read through the rules carefully before each captain signs this document, and must agree to adhere to the below.
  • By entering as a team into the tournament, all players acknowledge that they fully agree to the rules and terms of the tournament.
  • All players also acknowledge they are 16 years old and above inorder to legally participate in the tournament.
  • By failing to comply with prerequisites users will get eliminated from the tournament as well as banned
  • Organisers Events take the right to validate and confirm the details for each user before, during, and after the tournament takes place. If any irregularities are found at a player or at one or more members of the team, respective tournament organisers (“TO”) take the right to disqualify any player or the whole team from the tournament even after the tournament is finished.
  • All participating players are not allowed to play in another SEA tournament that has multiple conflicting scheduled games, which disallows them to be available for the league unless approved by tournament Administration
  • When in doubt about anything regarding rules or if you have any questions related to the following tournament, please contact the official discord channel which has been given to you.
  • Furthermore, any information provided in private messaging between Sea Waves Cup  Administration and players must remain private, this includes any discord or direct messages in regards to any aspect of the League that is not already public knowledge. Releasing this information may result in punishment pending League Administration review.

  • Quick Rules
  • The tournament format depends on the event and it is specified within the event rules seen under the Tournament Overview Format section.
  • When in a tournament, if a player or all team members don’t join the match within the 10 minutes connect game period, the match will count as an auto-loss and the opposing team will win the match or has to play with fewer players.
  • Tournament overview Format Section

Group Stage

  • Single round-robin
  • All matches are Bo2
  • Round robin format
  • Top 2 teams advance to the Upper Bracket Round 2 of the Playoffs
  • 3rd – 6th place teams advance to the Upper Bracket Round 1 of the Playoffs
  • Bottom 2 teams are eliminated 
  • Playoff stage
    • Double-elimination bracket
    • All matches except Grand Final are Bo3
    • Grand Final is Bo5

  • Teams & Players
    • A team must consist of a minimum of 5 players.
    • Real nicks must be used.
    • Tags must be used.
    • Stand-ins can be used online, max 3 in tournament
    • Stand-ins must not be a member of another team in the tournament.
    • Stand-ins must use a Stand-in tag before their nicknames.
    • Players cannot be replaced anytime during the tournament unless it’s an emergency situation.
    • If stand-ins are to be used, Admins must be notified at least 12 hours prior to the game.

  • Players Information
    • Players must send to the tournament organizer all the necessary information about the team and players at the official request of the organizer.

  • Accounts 
    • Player accounts
      • To be eligible to play in the Sea Waves Cup tournament , all players must provide up-to-date information below
        • Email
        • Discord ID
        • Steam ID
        • Name
        • Address
        • Age

  • It is the player’s responsibility to keep all of these up-to-date, and notify administration immediately of any changes. To play in the Sea Waves Cup all players must be available to be contacted within a reasonable time frame barring extreme circumstances, failure to respond to any request made by administration may subject the player to punishment.

  •  Account Sharing
    • Account sharing is strictly prohibited, any player who becomes known to have shared their account during any official tournament game will have immediate action taken upon them and may result in removal from the Sea Waves Cup.

  • Selection order
    • Automatic coin toss is used on the first map, on the second map the opposite command has the right of first choice.

  • Tiebreaker Rules
    • 2 way tie breaker:
      • BO3 matches will be played
  • 3 way tie breaker
    • BO1 matches will be played. Compare the seeds. Repeat until the tie is broken.

  • Flip tie breaker
    • In case of a tight schedule there will be a BO3 TOSS/FLIP in the lobby.
    • In case a team fails to join the lobby for the Tiebreaker, they will be eliminated from the tournament.

  • Sponsors / Partnerships
    • Sea Waves Cup  reserves the right to prohibit or remove teams with sponsors that are solely aimed at audiences not appropriate for the League. All team sponsorships must be approved before they are allowed to be used in either team names or logos. Failure to notify tournament administration may result in teams being removed from the league, and future bans may be implemented.

  • Game Servers
    • Default server is Singapore but any other server can be selected if both the teams and admin agree.
    • The game can be postponed for a maximum of 1 hour from the time of  its official start because of the delay of the previous game.
    • In case of the delay of a match for more than 1 hour – the teams have the right to ask to postpone the match for another day at a time convenient for them.
    • The game will be hosted by the admin at least 15 minutes before the first game is to start.
    •  A representative from each team must be in contact with an admin 15 mins before the game is supposed to start (Team Captain or Manager).
    •  All the players should be in the game 5 minutes before the game starts.

  • Game Penalty
    • 5 mins: 30 penalty points
    • 10 mins: 70 penalty points
    • 15 mins: 110 penalty points
    • 20 mins: Def Lose map 1

  • Map-Setting 
    • The following settings are to be used every game:
      • Lobby password: Will be shared on discord server after lobby creation. 
      • Cheats: Off
      • Bots: Off
      • All Chat: Off
      • Version: Tournament
      • Series: BO3
      • Finals: BO5
      • Gamemode: Captains Mode
      • Starting Team: Decided before the game
      • Punishments: None
      • Default Server: Singapore
      • Spectators: Tour Ticket
      • Dota TV Delay: 5 mins
      • The version to play is the current Tournament Version.
      • The mode to be played is CM.

  • Team/Player Behavior
    • Flaming and bad-mouthing are not allowed.
    • The usage of all-chat should be used to a minimum.
    • No offensive nicknames are allowed.
    • Players should, while in game, use their official nicks
    • Teams should, while in game, use their official tag

  • Streaming and spectating
    • No streaming allowed except for streamers chosen by administrators
    • Only chosen streamers, producers and admins will be allowed in the spectator-spots.

  • Game streaming languages:
    • English
    • Russian

  • Disconnects, pauses and crashes
    • Pausing is not allowed during picks unless the captain disconnects.
    • If the game crashes during the picks, the game will be remade and the same picks will be picked.
    • Players have rights to pause the game if needed. Be sure to announce the pause in all-chat a few seconds before if not an emergency.
    • The reason for the pause must be reasonable. Both teams must agree on resuming before resuming the game.
    • If a player disconnects, the player’s team should pause the game right away.
    • A team has the right to 10 minutes worth of pause per map. (per team and per map) After that, the opponent team can resume unless the admin stated otherwise.
    • If teams disconnect from the game completely and do not have any chance connect to the game again:
    • If the advantage of one of the teams is less than 15 000 – This map should be restart
    • If  the advantage of one of the teams is more than 15 000 – This team is winning on this map

  • Game end
    • The game is over when either team’s Ancient is destroyed or one of the team types “GG” in all chat.

  • Rules about awards for matches
    • Winning team gets 3 points
    • Losing team gets no points
  • Betting
    • No players, team managers, staff or management of attending organizations may be involved in betting or gambling, associate with betters or gamblers, or provide anyone any information that may assist betting or gambling, either directly or indirectly, for any of the tournament matches or the tournament in general.

  • Prize Pool
    • Prize pool will be given to the winning teams within 3-4 months after the conclusion of the tournament via Cryptocurrency/Crypto Wallet.
    • Prize pool(prize distribution) can be modified at any time during the event without any notice.

  •  Additional rule
    • Any rules can be changed or added during the event by the admins.

For Inquiries/Partnership
